BaseAssemblerÂ¶

struct asmjit::BaseAssembler
#include <assembler.h>

Base assembler.

This class implements core setialization API only. The platform specific methods and intrinsics is implemented by derived classes.

See
BaseCompiler.

Public Functions

ASMJIT_API BaseAssembler(BaseRuntime * runtime)

Create a new BaseAssembler instance.

ASMJIT_API ~BaseAssembler()

Destroy the BaseAssembler instance.

ASMJIT_API void clear()

Clear everything, but not deallocate buffers.

ASMJIT_API void reset()

Reset everything (means also to free all buffers).

ASMJIT_API void _purge()

Called by clear() and reset() to clear all data related to derived class implementation.

size_t getCapacity()

Get capacity of the code buffer.

size_t getRemainingSpace()

Get the number of remaining bytes (space between cursor and the end of the buffer).

uint8_t * getBuffer()

Get buffer.

uint8_t * getEnd()

Get the end of the buffer (points to the first byte that is outside).

uint8_t * getCursor()

Get the current position in the buffer.

void setCursor(uint8_t * cursor)

Set the current position in the buffer.

size_t getOffset()

Get the current offset in the buffer (_cursor - _buffer).

size_t setOffset(size_t offset)

Set the current offset in the buffer to offset and get the previous offset value.

ASMJIT_API Error _grow(size_t n)

Grow the internal buffer.

The internal buffer will grow at least by n bytes so n bytes can be added to it. If n is zero or getOffset() + n is not greater than the current capacity of the buffer this function won’t do anything.

ASMJIT_API Error _reserve(size_t n)

Reserve the internal buffer to at least n bytes.

uint8_t getByteAt(size_t pos)

Set byte at position pos.

uint16_t getWordAt(size_t pos)

Set word at position pos.

uint32_t getDWordAt(size_t pos)

Set dword at position pos.

uint64_t getQWordAt(size_t pos)

Set qword at position pos.

int32_t getInt32At(size_t pos)

Set int32_t at position pos.

uint32_t getUInt32At(size_t pos)

Set uint32_t at position pos.

void setByteAt(size_t pos, uint8_t x)

Set byte at position pos.

void setWordAt(size_t pos, uint16_t x)

Set word at position pos.

void setDWordAt(size_t pos, uint32_t x)

Set dword at position pos.

void setQWordAt(size_t pos, uint64_t x)

Set qword at position pos.

void setInt32At(size_t pos, int32_t x)

Set int32_t at position pos.

void setUInt32At(size_t pos, uint32_t x)

Set uint32_t at position pos.

size_t getCodeSize()

Get current offset in buffer (same as getOffset() + getTramplineSize()).

size_t getTrampolineSize()

Get size of all possible trampolines needed to successfuly generate relative jumps to absolute addresses. This value is only non-zero if jmp of call instructions were used with immediate operand (this means jumping or calling an absolute address directly).

size_t getLabelsCount()

Get count of labels created.

bool isLabelCreated(const Label & label)

Get whether label is created.

LabelData * getLabelData(const Label & label)

LabelData * getLabelDataById(uint32_t id)

ASMJIT_API Error _registerIndexedLabels(size_t index)

ASMJIT_API Error _newLabel(Label * dst)

ASMJIT_API LabelLink * _newLabelLink()

Label newLabel()

Create and return new label.

void _bind(const Label & label)

Bind label to the current offset (virtual).

void bind(const Label & label)

Bind label to the current offset (virtual).

Note
Label can be bound only once!

ASMJIT_API Error embed(const void * data, uint32_t size)

Embed data into the code buffer.

Error align(uint32_t m)

Align target buffer to m bytes.

Typical usage of this is to align labels at start of the inner loops.

Inserts nop() instructions or CPU optimized NOPs.

Error _align(uint32_t m)

Align target buffer to m bytes (virtual).

size_t relocCode(void * dst)

Simplifed version of relocCode() method designed for JIT.

This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

size_t relocCode(void * dst, Ptr base)

Relocate code to a given address dst.

A given buffer will be overwritten, to get number of bytes required use getCodeSize().

Parameters
  • dst -

    Where the relocated code should me stored. The pointer can be address returned by virtual memory allocator or your own address if you want only to store the code for later reuse (or load, etc...).

  • addressBase -

    Base address used for relocation. When using JIT code generation, this will be the same as dst, only casted to system integer type. But when generating code for remote process then the value can be different.

Return Value
  • The -

    bytes used. Code-generator can create trampolines which are used when calling other functions inside the JIT code. However, these trampolines can be unused so the relocCode() returns the exact size needed for the function.

size_t _relocCode(void * dst, Ptr base)

Reloc code (virtual).

ASMJIT_API void * make()

Make is a convenience method to make and relocate the current code into the associated runtime.

What is needed is only to cast the returned pointer to your function type and then use it. If there was an error during make() NULL is returned and the last error code can be obtained by calling getError().

ASMJIT_API Error emit(uint32_t code)

Emit an instruction.

ASMJIT_API Error emit(uint32_t code, const Operand & o0)

This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

ASMJIT_API Error emit(uint32_t code, const Operand & o0, const Operand & o1)

This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

ASMJIT_API Error emit(uint32_t code, const Operand & o0, const Operand & o1, const Operand & o2)

This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

Error emit(uint32_t code, const Operand & o0, const Operand & o1, const Operand & o2, const Operand & o3)

This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

ASMJIT_API Error emit(uint32_t code, int o0)

Emit an instruction with integer immediate operand.

ASMJIT_API Error emit(uint32_t code, const Operand & o0, int o1)

This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

ASMJIT_API Error emit(uint32_t code, const Operand & o0, const Operand & o1, int o2)

This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

ASMJIT_API Error emit(uint32_t code, const Operand & o0, const Operand & o1, const Operand & o2, int o3)

This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

Error _emit(uint32_t code, const Operand & o0, const Operand & o1, const Operand & o2, const Operand & o3)

Emit an instruction (virtual).

Public Members

uint8_t * _buffer

Buffer where the code is emitted (either live or temporary).

This is actually the base pointer of the buffer, to get the current position (cursor) look at the _cursor member.

uint8_t * _end

The end of the buffer (points to the first invalid byte).

The end of the buffer is calculated as _buffer + size.

uint8_t * _cursor

The current position in code _buffer.

uint32_t _trampolineSize

Size of possible trampolines.

const char * _comment

Inline comment that will be logged by the next instruction and set to NULL.

LabelLink * _unusedLinks

Linked list of unused links (LabelLink* structures)

PodVector < LabelData > _labels

Labels data.

PodVector < RelocData > _relocData

Relocations data.

Private Functions

BaseAssembler(const BaseAssembler & other)

BaseAssembler & operator=(const BaseAssembler & other)
